Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.ui.swing.useful

Class JFileContentManipulator

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.ui.swing.useful.JFileContentManipulator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Localizer.LocaleChangeListener, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class JFileContentManipulator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, Localizer.LocaleChangeListener

This class is used to support opening/editing/saving any content in the Swing applications. It implements very popular ability to create new or open existing file and to save it after modification. To use this class, you need:

  • create this class instance and associate it with any existent JTextComponent on the Swing form
  • assign ActionListener to the application menu items to call newFile(), openFile(), saveFile() and saveFileAs() methods
  • associate WindowListener with the application menu items and/or application window to call close() method
  • assign DocumentListener to your JTextComponent to call setModificationFlag() method
  • enjoy!

This class can also be used to manipulate any sort of content, not only visual editors. To use this class, you need create class instance with the JFileContentManipulator(FileSystemInterface, Localizer, InputStreamGetter, OutputStreamGetter) constructor and mark it's modification state programmatically.

Since:
0.0.3
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
JFileSelectionDialog, FileSystemInterface, Localizer
